node.title: Friendlyjordies apologises to John Barilaro, settles defamation suit
node.alt: a composite image of john barilaro and a young man in front of a microphone
node.description: As part of the settlement, comedian Jordan Shanks has issued an apology to John Barilaro for any offence caused by videos he posted on social media.
node.content: ["Former NSW deputy premier John Barilaro has settled a defamation case against YouTube comedian Jordan Shanks.", "Mr Barilaro was suing Mr Shanks, better known as friendlyjordies, in the Federal Court over a series of videos published last year.", "Mr Shanks's barrister, Matt Collins QC, today read out a statement on behalf of his client after the court heard the matter has been settled.", "\"Freedom of expression for political communication is important, but Mr Shanks accepts that some of the videos posted were offensive to Mr Barilaro,\" he said.", "\"Mr Shanks understands that Mr Barilaro has been hurt and apologises to him for that hurt.\"", "Mr Shanks's solicitor, Mark Davis, said no damages had been paid to Mr Barilaro and none of the material in question\u00a0had been removed from the friendlyjordies YouTube channel.", "\"Our client will not be paying a single cent in damages to Mr Barilaro. Not one video will be taken down,\" Mr Davis said.", "He said Mr Shanks had been denied the defence of truth \"because of the parliamentary privilege enjoyed by Mr Barilaro\".", "\"Under the circumstances, we are more than satisfied that the action has been withdrawn.\"", "Mr Davis said Mr Shanks had agreed to stop selling merchandise featuring Mr Barilaro upon his retirement from politics.", "He said there although costs had been awarded against Mr Shanks in relation to a number of previous hearings, there had been no new order as to costs.", "In a statement posted on Twitter, Mr Barilaro indicated that his legal fight was not over.", "\"I am pleased that my defamation claims against Jordan Shanks have settled. I am grateful for and accept Mr Shanks' apology to me, and trust that we can now each move on with our lives,\" he said.", "\"Regrettably, my defamation claims against Google have not settled, and will be determined by the Federal Court in March next year.\""]
